Material used.Description: Primary cortical neurons were used to study the effects of A53T α-synuclein overexpression on mitochondrial dysfunction and autophagy.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Enhanced mitochondrial destruction and bioenergetic deficit
Readout description.Result Description: Overexpression of A53T α-synuclein led to increased mitochondrial fragmentation, reduced ATP production, and neuronal degeneration. Silencing Parkin, overexpressing wild-type Mitofusin 2, or inhibiting autophagy reduced these effects.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature

Basic positive control.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal mitochondrial function and ATP production

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant mitochondrial fragmentation and ATP reduction
